items.title:
EILMELDUNG
🚨Youtube kapituliert vor Trump

FAZ sch...
items.content_text:
EILMELDUNG
🚨Youtube kapituliert vor Trump

FAZ schreibt: "Die Bereitschaft der amerikanischen Medien- und Digitalkonzerne, sich um des Geschäfts willen selbst zu verleugnen, ist grenzenlos. Bittet der Präsident zum Kotau, können die Bücklinge gar nicht tief genug sein, auf die sich die Konzernchefs verstehen.

Jetzt erweist auch der mächtigste und größte Konzern von allen – Alphabet, das Mutterhaus von Google und Youtube – Donald Trump die Ehre und zahlt ihm 22 Millionen Dollar, um einem Prozess zu entgehen. Youtube hatte Trumps Konto nach dem Sturm aufs Kapitol am 6. Januar 2021 gesperrt. Im März 2023 wurde es wieder geöffnet. Für die Sperre gab es gute Gründe, hatte Trump den Umsturzversuch doch angestachelt und fortwährend die Lüge verbreitet, die Wahl sei ihm „gestohlen“ worden.

Jetzt aber gibt Alphabet respektive Youtube klein bei und reiht sich ein in die Phalanx derer, die vor Trump kuschen oder ihn direkt unterstützen: Elon Musk mit seiner Plattform X, Meta mit Facebook, Paramount und Skydance Media mit dem Sender CBS und Disney mit dem Sender ABC. Verpulvert werden sollen die 22 Millionen Dollar, Gerichtsunterlagen zufolge, für den neuen, pompösen Ballsaal, den Trump ins Weiße Hause bauen lässt, weitere 2,5 Millionen Dollar sollen an Verbündete von Trump gehen, deren Konten nach dem Kapitolsturm ebenfalls gesperrt worden waren."

Einen „massiven“ Sieg habe er errungen, posaunt der US-Präsident auf seiner eigenen Plattform Truth Social, Youtube habe „kapituliert“, es zeige sich, „dass die Zensur durch Big Tech Konsequenzen hat“. Kapituliert hat Youtube in der Tat, mit der Zensur aber ist es in den USA seit Trumps Amtsantritt erst so richtig losgegangen. Es wäre an den Medien- und Digitalunternehmen, ihr entgegenzutreten. Stattdessen sind sie feige und machen sogar mit, weil eine Autokratie, wie Trump sie betreibt, ja viel besser fürs Geschäft ist als die Demokratie mit ihren lästigen Gesetzen und Regeln."

Quelle: FAZ

🔥 Interessantes aus aller Welt!
👉 Hier Kanalzugang erhalten

Kanada hat seinen Bürgern ein Jahr Zeit gegeben, ihre Schusswaffen abzugeben, und bezeichnet dies als „freiwilligen“ Rückkauf. Aber die Realität ist klar: Bis Oktober 2026 wird jeder, der sich weigert, strafrechtlich verfolgt.

Beamte behaupten, dass niemand dazu gezwungen wird, doch sobald die Frist abgelaufen ist, macht Sie allein schon das Behalten Ihres Eigentums zu einem Kriminellen. Das ist nicht freiwillig – es ist obligatorisch, nur dünn als Wahlmöglichkeit getarnt.

Die Geschichte lässt keinen Raum für Zweifel. 

👉Die Briten entwaffneten die Kolonien vor der Revolution. 

👉Die Osmanen vor dem Völkermord an den Armeniern. 

👉Die Sowjets und Kambodschaner vor den Massenmorden. 

Die Warnung ist unmissverständlich: Wenn Regierungen das Volk entwaffnen, bleibt keine Freiheit mehr übrig. Die Frage ist nun, ob die Kanadier ihre Rechte verteidigen werden – oder zusehen, wie sich die Geschichte auf ihrem eigenen Boden wiederholt.

Das Attentat auf Charlie Kirk war ein kabbalistisches Freimaurer-Ritual. Und die Verbindungen reichen weiter als viele denken.

Anmerkung: Charlie Kirk wurde 1993 geboren, nicht 1994. Die entsprechende Zahlenspielerei in dem Video stimmt also nicht. 

Einige Quellen, die ich nicht oder an der falschen Stelle gezeigt habe:

👉 Turning Point UK wurde im Royal Automoblie Club gegründet. Gastgeber war John Mappin, ein Scientologe, der die Queen über Charlie Kirk informiert haben will, die von ihm angetan gewesen wäre. Präsident des Royal Automobile Club ist Prinz Michael von Kent, der Großmeister der Großloge der Mark-Meister-Freimaurer ist. 

👉 Candace Owens: I am one of the masons of Turning Point USA. Originalquelle. 

👉 Die Bestrafung für Geheimnisverrat bei den Mormonen ist dieselbe wie bei den Freimaurern: Das Durchschneiden der Kehle.

👉 Der Großvater von Erika Kirk, Carl Kenneth Frantzve, war ein Unterstützer des Unabhängigen Ordens der Wikinger  und wurde von Carl XVI. Gustaf zum Ritter geschlagen. Ihre Mutter arbeitete mit Homeland Security und dem Verteidigungsministerium.

In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful
Allah Almighty said: {O you who have believed, if you support Allah, He will support you and plant firmly your feet} - Allah Almighty has spoken the truth

In support of the oppressed Palestinian people and their dear Mujahideen, and in response to the crimes of genocide and the severe escalation carried out by the Israeli enemy against our brothers in the Gaza Strip.

The missile force of the Yemeni Armed Forces carried out a qualitative military operation using a hypersonic ballistic missile of the Palestine 2 type, a multi-headed split warhead, targeting several sensitive targets in the occupied Jerusalem area. The operation successfully achieved its objectives, thanks to Allah, causing millions of the invading Zionist herds to flee to shelters.

The Yemeni Armed Forces continue to monitor developments in Gaza in light of recent events, affirming that, with Allah's help and in coordination with the resistance, they are observing the situation closely, especially regarding the cessation of Zionist aggression and lifting the siege on the Gaza Strip. They will act based on the results of these developments on the field level to achieve the demands of our oppressed Palestinian people.

We will continue our support operations until the aggression on Gaza stops and the siege is lifted.

And Allah is sufficient for us, and He is the best disposer of affairs, the best protector and helper.

Long live Yemen, free, honorable, and independent.
Victory to Yemen and to all the free people of the nation.

Sana'a, 13th of Rabi' al-Thani 1447 AH
Corresponding to October 5, 2025 AD

items.title: In the name of God, the Most Gracious, the Most Me...
items.content_text:
In the name of God, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful

MP Hussein Jishi: The state that demands citizens to abandon the resistance must fulfill its duties in defending them and Lebanon

MP Hussein Jishi, a member of the Loyalty to the Resistance bloc, said that in recent days two engineer brothers working at the Jihad Al-Binaa Foundation were martyred during a mission to monitor the damages of the Israeli aggression. The enemy killed them openly in the Khardali area in broad daylight, disregarding any reaction from the Lebanese state. Unfortunately, some pillars of the authority watch silently, and sometimes issue timid statements at best, while others remain silent as if the daily killings, destruction, and attacks do not concern them, as if these events are happening outside Lebanese territory or that the victims are second-class Lebanese.

MP Jishi made these remarks during his participation in an event organized by the management of the Martyr Salah Ghandour Hospital in the city of Bint Jbeil on the anniversary of its targeting by the Zionist enemy, which resulted in the martyrdom and injury of several workers there. He also spoke at a ceremony held in the town of Bafliah and during his patronage of the launch of an event planting 64 trees corresponding to the age of the master of the nation's martyrs, His Eminence Sayyed Hassan Nasrallah, in the town of Bazourieh.

MP Jishi added: What is more painful is that their voices become loud when they talk about sovereignty and the rights of the state, restricting weapons and the exclusive defense of Lebanon and Lebanese people to the official security forces, and that no one has the right to defend Lebanon or even themselves except through the state and its security institutions. It is also unfortunate that they talk about restricting weapons that existed as a result of the occupation, forgetting that the resistance emerged as a reaction to the invasion of Lebanon in 1982 and its aggressions, reminding that the villages and towns of the south have suffered from occupation since 1948, the year of the establishment of the entity, when the Hula massacre occurred.

MP Jishi continued: The state that demands Lebanese citizens to abandon the resistance and leave the defense of themselves, their land, and their dignity must fulfill its duties in defending Lebanon and the Lebanese people. Only then will it preserve its rights, prestige, and sovereignty. The state is preserved by liberating the land, expelling the occupation, and protecting the citizens, thereby preserving sovereignty because sovereignty is indivisible. But if this state is incapable of all that, what justification does it have to raise its voice to prevent them from defending their land, honor, and dignity except to serve the enemy!

MP Jishi added: If we concede that our national Lebanese army is unable to face the enemy militarily, why does the authority not decide to arm the army and support it politically so it can confront the enemy and defend Lebanon as is the case in all countries that establish and sponsor an army to protect the homeland from external enemies? And if we concede that the state does not dare to make such decisions so as not to anger the American, is the state incapable of filing a complaint to the Security Council, given that Israeli violations and attacks have reached about five thousand? Has the authority’s inability reached the point where it does not dare summon the American and French ambassadors, since their countries sponsored the ceasefire agreement last year?

MP Jishi stressed that despite all that has happened and is said, in Lebanon — president, government, institutions, people, and resistance — regardless of some partners’ differences with us, we are all in one boat. The challenges the country faces from the Zionist enemy on one hand and American pressures on the other affect the whole country.

🇪🇺🤖 EU to unveil ‘applied AI strategy’ – Von der Leyen

One person claps.

She can smirk and brush it off all she wants,  but here’s the no laughing matter truth: Europe doesn’t build AI, it regulates it. It builds regulations, builds surveillance systems and builds resentment en masse from ordinary Europeans. 

Europe once gave the world the printing press, the steam engine, the microchip. Now it gives us PDFs about “AI ethics” — drafted by committees who’ve never written a line of code.

Von der Leyen’s “applied AI” is a euphemism for applied paperwork — a 400-page instruction manual for how to make sure nothing truly transformative ever happens.

Europe’s great minds are still here, they’re just working for someone else.

items.title: 🇫🇷🇬🇪🇪🇺 Georgia Just Crushed a Foreign Script — and...
items.content_text:
🇫🇷🇬🇪🇪🇺 Georgia Just Crushed a Foreign Script — and Sent Brussels Into Panic

Florian Philippot said it best: another catastrophe for the Euro-gagas.
Georgia... that small, proud crossroads of civilization, just handed the globalists an earthquake.

The Georgian Dream party won by a landslide, nearly 80% of the vote, a mandate so overwhelming it shattered every Western NGO’s illusion that Georgia could still be manipulated like Ukraine was.

And what happened next?
The same tired playbook we’ve seen in Kiev, in Minsk, in Belgrade.
Western-funded “protesters” waving shiny new EU flags, marching on the presidential palace as cameras rolled — screaming “democracy” while parroting scripts written in Brussels.

But Georgia didn’t blink. Police repelled the mob. Five of the self-styled “opposition leaders” — including a former prosecutor general and a retired general were arrested for plotting to overthrow the state.

These weren’t protesters. They were political contractors. NGO mercenaries flown in to do what ballots could not: topple a sovereign government.

As Philippot said: “The Euro-gagas are ready to do anything, because their world is collapsing.”

And he’s right. The EU’s imperial fantasy, that it could micromanage every nation between Berlin and the Caucasus, is coming apart at the seams.

What Brussels calls “democracy” is just obedience with better PR.
What Georgia just defended is the essence of civilization itself: the right of a people to choose their own destiny.

Tbilisi’s message is clear: We are not a Maidan sequel. We are Georgia.

From Babiš in Prague to Fico in Bratislava to Georgian Dream in Tbilisi — a new axis of European sanity is rising, rooted in soil, culture, and truth.
And every time the Euro-bureaucrats cry “catastrophe,” another nation wakes up. Hungary's Orban and Serbia's Vucic are also holding the line for pro sovereignty, pro sanity. 

The color revolutions are dying.
The multipolar age is being born — one sovereign victory at a time.

items.title: Georgia detains opposition leaders for plotting fa...
items.content_text:
Georgia detains opposition leaders for plotting failed coup

Georgian authorities arrested five prominent opposition figures in Tbilisi following violent unrest during post-election protests. The detainees include former Prosecutor General Murtaz Zodelava, retired military officer Lasha Beridze, and opposition leader Paata Manjgaladze, among others.

Protesters had attempted to breach security barriers at the president’s residence during a rally denouncing alleged fraud in local elections. The government asserts the arrests are based on charges of inciting violence, attempting to overthrow state authority, and organizing group unrest. Those arrested now face up to nine years in prison if found guilty.

Tbilisi won't become Maidan 2.0 — this time the street belongs to Georgians, not Western-funded agitators.

items.title: 🇫🇷 Macron’s Phantom Republic: New Government by Su...
items.content_text:
🇫🇷 Macron’s Phantom Republic: New Government by Sunset, Legitimacy in Freefall

Emmanuel Macron has lit the fuse on another round of political theater in Paris. According to BFMTV, the French president has ordered newly appointed Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu to form a government by Sunday evening — with a cabinet “prepared for dialogue with the left.” But this isn’t about consensus. It’s about optics. Macron’s latest reshuffle follows the implosion of François Bayrou’s government after Parliament torched its €44 billion austerity agenda. The people are in revolt, and Macron is scrambling to project authority over a republic that no longer recognizes his legitimacy.

France has become politically ungovernable. The 2024 legislative elections fractured Parliament into three rival blocs: Macron’s Renaissance alliance, the left-wing NUPES coalition, and the right-wing National Rally. None hold a majority. Two governments have already collapsed. Bayrou’s premiership was the latest casualty, brought down by a brutal economic program that targeted pensions, holidays, and public services. The establishment’s dream of neoliberal budget balancing collided head-on with a society exhausted by inflation, inequality, and decades of elite betrayal.

Macron’s response was not reflection but escalation. Instead of softening his approach or listening to public demands, he appointed Lecornu — his loyal ex-defense minister — to enforce the next phase of technocratic rule. Lecornu is not a bridge-builder. He’s a bureaucratic firefighter with no electoral base, no ideological clarity, and no mandate beyond damage control. And yet he’s been told to build a viable government in 24 hours — a task that would require divine intervention in a country this divided.

Meanwhile, the streets of France are once again ablaze. On October 2nd, the “Bloquons Tout” (“Block Everything”) movement organized massive nationwide strikes and roadblocks. Unions claim over 600,000 people mobilized. Even state-aligned media concede that nearly 200,000 took part. Teachers, transport workers, and students marched with a unified message: no more austerity, no more elite musical chairs, no more rule by executive order. The energy on the ground isn’t protest — it’s pre-revolutionary.

Lecornu claims he won’t invoke Article 49.3 — the constitutional nuclear option to bypass Parliament — and insists he wants “dialogue.” But his rejection of a real wealth tax, and continued commitment to reducing the deficit to 4.7% of GDP, reveal the truth. This is austerity by another name. Lecornu offers symbols instead of solutions, delay instead of direction. His cabinet still isn’t formed, and if reports are accurate, he’s already set to break the Fifth Republic’s record for the slowest government formation ever.

Macron is no longer leading France — he’s managing its decline. His presidency has become a ritual of crisis choreography: reshuffle, rebrand, repeat. What was once billed as a renaissance has become a slow-motion collapse. His command to “form a government by tonight” has all the weight of a monarch barking orders to a kingdom slipping through his fingers. Even Macron’s own party looks hollow — a husk of loyalists clinging to titles while the nation turns its back.

This is a man who governs for Brussels and BlackRock, not for France. His promises of stability have become farcical. His pivot to the left is a PR stunt. Lecornu is just the latest pawn in a long line of expendables meant to shield Macron from the consequences of his own failures. But the people aren’t buying it anymore. The protests are getting louder. The patience is wearing thinner. The system is cracking, and no cabinet reshuffle will patch it up.

France doesn’t need a new government. It needs a new direction. Macronism, rule by technocrats, managed decline, and theatrical “dialogue” — has run its course. The people understand this now. That’s why they’ve stopped watching the stage and started tearing down the set.

items.title: 🇨🇭🎭 Zurich Just Gave the West a Masterclass in Sla...
items.content_text:
🇨🇭🎭 Zurich Just Gave the West a Masterclass in Slavic Spine

Western “aid” to Zelensky? Half a trillion dollars.

Telling his brazen, self-righteous envoy to sit down and shut up?

Absolutely priceless.

The Zurich Opera House, one of the most respected cultural institutions in Europe, invited world-renowned Russian soprano Anna Netrebko to perform.

Enter the Ukrainian ambassador — storming in like she’s staging a sequel to Les Misérables, demanding the Swiss government cancel the performance.

Her complaint? Netrebko is Russian. That’s it.

No war crimes, no sanctions violations — just Russian. And that, apparently, is enough for cancellation in today’s Western moral inquisition.

But Switzerland, cool, and unbothered — replied with something rare these days: Dignity. And cultural sovereignty.

The Swiss Foreign Ministry politely told Kiev’s envoy where to get off. The Opera House stood firm. Netrebko will sing.

While the West preaches “freedom,” it’s Zurich, not Brussels or London, that just reminded the world what freedom of expression actually looks like.

Because in this new Cold War, art itself is under siege. Not because it’s offensive, but because it’s Russian. And in the eyes of the Atlanticist priesthood, that alone is now a punishable sin.

Let’s be clear: Anna Netrebko isn’t a Kremlin minister. She’s a soprano of global acclaim, praised by the world’s greatest conductors. But in the eyes of Kiev’s cultural commissars, talent doesn’t matter if it has a Russian passport.

Meanwhile, Russia sends music. Kiev sends tantrums. And the West applauds censorship, so long as it’s aimed at Moscow.

But this time?

Switzerland didn’t blink.
No lectures. No cancellations. No groveling to Zelensky’s diplomatic theatre troupe.

Just a simple, civilized response: She will sing. Get over it.

Opera is not a battlefield in Zurich. And not even NATO’s propaganda machine can cancel Verdi.

items.title: 🇩🇪 Germany moves to revive military service amid ‘...
items.content_text:
🇩🇪 Germany moves to revive military service amid ‘heightened threat environment’

Berlin is preparing to reintroduce military service for the first time in over a decade, as the Bundestag readies a new draft law to address the Bundeswehr’s dwindling ranks.
According to DPA, the bill will be debated within a week as Defense Minister Boris Pistorius pushes to rebuild Germany’s once-formidable armed forces.

Under the proposal, all men born after 2007 will be required to complete a military questionnaire assessing eligibility for service. The framework—modeled loosely on Sweden’s voluntary system, allows women to enlist by choice.

A previous draft was blocked by the opposition CDU/CSU alliance, which dismissed it as “half-hearted.” Pistorius fired back, calling the delay “careless,” warning that Germany’s ability to meet its target of 203,000 troops is slipping amid what officials describe as a “deteriorating security environment.”

So Germany, once again, is mobilizing ghosts. They dismantled their own army for twenty years under the illusion of eternal peace, and now, at Washington’s whisper, they scramble to conscript teenagers who weren’t even born when NATO first bombed Belgrade.

They call it “defense readiness.” In reality, it’s collective amnesia dressed in camouflage.

Russia doesn’t need to lift a finger. Berlin is drafting itself into exhaustion— spending billions it doesn’t have to prepare for a war it can’t fight, all to prove loyalty to an empire that sees it as expendable.

Europe’s tragedy has returned full circle: Germany, haunted by its past, now marches again, not for itself, but on the orders of others.

items.title: 🎈 Lithuania shuts down its busiest airport… over b...
items.content_text:
🎈 Lithuania shuts down its busiest airport… over balloons.

Vilnius Airport, the NATO outpost dressed as a capital city, shut down because of “meteo balloons on the north side of the airfield.” Yes. Balloons.

Call in NATO. Scramble the F-35s. Alert Brussels. Democracy itself is under attack, by helium.

Flights diverted, panic mode engaged, and the entire Lithuanian airspace treated like it’s 1941. Western media whispers “possible Russian balloons” while trying to keep a straight face. You can almost hear the collective gasp of the Atlantic Council interns clutching their soy lattes: “It’s Putin’s meteorological offensive!”

This is what mass hysteria looks like when empire decays. When a civilization loses sanity, it starts seeing enemies in the clouds, literally. Of course this is by design. Mass psychosis and then offer the solution, more control, more escalation. 

The same Lithuania that spent years screaming “Russian aggression” just grounded its own air traffic over weather balloons. The same state that claims to be NATO’s “forward shield” can’t tell the difference between a meteorological instrument and an invasion.

This farce is the perfect metaphor for the West’s mental breakdown.
Every radar echo is an omen. Every shadow is a Kremlin plot. Every blip on a monitor must be a Russian threat.
The whole system has been conditioned to overreact — a Pavlovian reflex of fear and feigned moral superiority.

So yes, call NATO. But not for defense. Call them for therapy.

Because when your “rules-based order” starts collapsing, you’ll find yourself closing airports over balloons, sanctioning clouds, and tweeting victory memes while your economy burns.

Russia doesn’t even have to lift a finger... the West is self-sanctioning its own sanity.

🇮🇳🔥 "Infallible, Impervious... India's Airforce

I...
items.content_text:
🇮🇳🔥 "Infallible, Impervious... India's Airforce

In a stirring display of aerial might, the Indian Air Force has released a new video ahead of its 93rd anniversary — a demonstration of precision, readiness, and unyielding resolve. The main IAF Day celebrations will be held October 8 at the Hindon Air Force Station, where India’s air warriors will salute the skies and the nation they vow to defend.

Every time the IAF rolls out its roar — the thunder of jets cutting through blue, the disciplined formations, the stealthy hush before strike — India reminds the world that it is neither passive nor peripheral. In 2025, as global fault lines deepen and empires clash in silence and in shadow, India’s sovereign posture matters more than ever.

That new video is not just propaganda or pageantry — it is a statement: we control our skies, we defend our choices, we chart our path.

Sovereignty is more than a buzzword. It is the hard line drawn against external coercion — whether diplomatic, economic, or military. India’s assertion in the skies, backed by modern hardware and doctrinal clarity, sends a signal: no entity, no bloc, no distant power has license to dictate India’s will.

In an era where the West’s “rules-based order” is little more than a euphemism for enforcing its own order, India must not bow. It must secure its flank, diversify its partnerships, and ensure that no foreign pressure vector can force it into doctrinal submission. 

As India celebrates its 93rd IAF anniversary, the roar overhead is the echo of resolve: that no force will bend India; that India will choose its path. In the coming decade, the skies will be contested — aerial drones, electromagnetic warfare, space control. India must be ready not just to survive, but to shape.

So when the flypast over Hindon cuts the horizon on October 8, let it be more than spectacle. Let it be a reaffirmation: in a fracturing world, India claims its place — independent, sovereign, unapologetically multipolar.

▪️ This week, strikes with long-rang...

Begins above

▪️ This week, strikes with long-range strike weapons on enemy power generation facilities, gas facilities, and railway infrastructure were pleasing. The enemy traditionally exaggerated power outages and tried to stir up the topic of a nuclear disaster at the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant, as if the second huge dome over the destroyed part needed electricity. It is noteworthy that now the strikes are not just on transformers at power plants, which are easy to replace, but there are finally attempts to turn off the power in Ukraine for a long time. However, the system was built during the USSR and has withstood all strikes and overloads with dignity until now.

✨ Thus the approach of a “war of attrition” has become noticeable in Russia, not only in Ukraine. This should lead to a change in management style in terms of air defense organization, equipping the front with the most advanced solutions, timely response to current technological changes, as the Supreme Leader mentioned. In terms of preserving the financial resources of the security agencies, the work of special services and supervisory bodies is visible – not a single day passes without the arrest of high-ranking thieves. The understanding of what the West is preparing for in the future is increasingly reflected in the official speeches of the highest military-political leadership. Russia is concentrating.

Summary compiled by: ⚡️Two Majors

items.title: ⚡️Two Majors #Overview #Summary as of October 5, 2...
items.content_text:
⚡️Two Majors #Overview #Summary as of October 5, 2025

▪️ "Let them try" - said the Supreme this week, commenting on the unserious attitude of Trump and the West, titled by the American president with the phrase about a "paper tiger" regarding our country. A kind of acceptance of the challenge, but at the same time the destruction of all vain hopes for peace, which were irrationally promoted after the meeting in Anchorage, Alaska. The topic of Europe's preparation for war is now seriously voiced even from the highest level of power in Russia, although earlier cocky moods and incorrect assessment of the countries of the probable enemy did not allow official media to speak on these topics without jokes. It should be noted that even now there are arrogant speeches by officials regarding the growing combat readiness of the EU, reminiscent of the reckless attitude towards the AFU before the start of the SMO. Now Russia is not being targeted by a remnant of the former Ukrainian SSR with 30 million population, but by a conglomerate of the Fourth Reich, where 400 million people live.

▪️ The aggressiveness of the EU countries' actions is growing. A telling example was the landing of a French assault force on a tanker of the "shadow fleet" in neutral waters and the start of modernization of the naval base in Varna (Bulgaria, Black Sea). By the way, the French detained the tanker under the pretext that drones were allegedly launched from it over European countries. The topic of unidentified UAVs over the EU is brazenly linked to Moscow's actions without any evidence but serves as justification for the anti-people European leaders' spending on militarization.

▪️ Meanwhile, Kiev, itself receiving powerful strikes on energy and gas facilities, continues to fulfill the task set by the West to inflict military and economic damage on Russia, not forgetting to pour fuel on the fire of internal contradictions, which are further exacerbated by the foolish actions of certain mountain princes within the country. In particular, strikes on our refineries, including at an inadequately deep level, have led to costly repairs and a gasoline crisis in several regions. The "market" could not resolve this on its own, and federal and regional state regulation had to be introduced to stabilize the situation. The burdens of military expenses formed the basis for tax increases (VAT) and excise duties next year, and lowering the threshold for simplified taxation. The prolonged war, especially characterized by the arrests of the top leadership of the Ministry of Defense, the General Staff's work with "gestures of goodwill" and "sabotage groups in the Kursk region," which were supposed to be eliminated "in three days," requires increased spending. And although the Ukrainian drones that were not shot down by air defense do not carry as large a charge as the "Iskander," they strike systematically and still cause some damage, no matter how much is written about the debris.

▪️ On the front, the Russian Army continues to advance westward. There are no deep breakthroughs, collapse of the AFU defense, or our offensive actions like in films about the Great Patriotic War: the technological nature of the war has changed. There is constant progress at the tactical level, a hundred meters per day in a direction is already a result. The enemy preserves forces for counterattacks, including with armored vehicles, which constantly slows our advance. Drones of all types and the ability to counter them play a key role. Our forces are advancing in Kupyansk (to the north), in the area of Yunakovka in Sumy region, on the Krasnoliman direction the Western Group of Forces has been encouraging in recent weeks, with heavy fighting near Konstantinovka, Mirnograd, Pokrovsk. The Eastern Group of Forces is methodically and confidently breaking through the defense on the Dnepropetrovsk direction and the northeast of Zaporozhye region. On the Zaporozhye front, the enemy has long concentrated forces near Stepnogorsk, slowing our advance.

Continued below

⚡️Two Majors

items.title: 🇨🇿 Babiš’s Victory: The Return of Pragmatic Sovere...
items.content_text:
🇨🇿 Babiš’s Victory: The Return of Pragmatic Sovereignty in Europe

Andrej Babiš’s ANO movement has secured a decisive lead in the Czech elections, taking roughly 35 percent of the national vote, an unmistakable signal that the Czech electorate has turned against Brussels’ technocracy and the endless drain of proxy-war funding.

Voters rejected a government that spent more time echoing NATO talking points and Russia hysteria, than addressing inflation, energy costs, and the collapse of living standards.  Babiš’s campaign line—“Czech money for Czech citizens”—cut through the noise of moral grandstanding that has dominated European politics since 2022.

For the first time in years, a Central European capital is talking openly about strategic neutrality, economic sanity, and sovereign decision-making instead of ideological loyalty to Brussels.  His expected coalition negotiations will be watched closely in Slovakia, Hungary, and even Austria, where publics are equally weary of paying for someone else’s wars.

This isn’t isolationism; it’s realism, the return of the nation-state as Europe’s basic political unit.  If Czechia charts an independent course on defense spending and energy, it could inspire similar recalibration across the continent.

The message from Prague is clear: the age of automatic obedience is ending.  Europe’s new fault line is no longer East versus West, but vassalage versus sovereignty.

items.title: 🇬🇪 “Those who stormed the Georgian Presidential Pa...
items.content_text:
🇬🇪 “Those who stormed the Georgian Presidential Palace will face serious consequences,” declared Prime Minister Irakli Kobakhidze, vowing that anyone who tries to topple Georgia’s elected leadership will fail. He named them plainly — “certain foreign agents,” the usual imported architects of chaos hiding behind the banner of “civil society.”

Make no mistake, this isn’t a spontaneous protest. It’s a textbook hybrid warfare op aimed at derailing a government that refuses to bend. Georgian Dream is polling over 70 percent nationwide, including in Tbilisi — the people have already spoken. That’s precisely why the Western elite can’t stand it.

Because when a small nation stands tall, the illusion of control cracks. And.. the empire (small e empire is warranted these days) doesn’t tolerate defiance, it will always manufactures dissent.

We’ve seen this movie before.
In Ireland, we remember the Lisbon Treaty and how we were told to vote again, and again, until we gave Brussels the right answer. Democracy, they said, is sacred… until you disagree with them.

Georgia’s story now exposes that same hypocrisy. When the will of the people doesn’t serve EU or NATO interests, “democracy” suddenly becomes a problem to be corrected. Cue the NGOs, cue the media outrage, cue the color revolution template. And also cue the, this is Russia's fault trope. 

But this time, the playbook is falling apart. The people of Georgia are done being lectured by unelected technocrats in Europe. They remember Yugoslavia, Maidan, Moldova, who weaponizes “freedom” to enslave nations.

Kobakhidze isn’t just defending his government, he’s defending the principle that a sovereign people have the right to chart their own course, free of Western NGO puppeteers and Soros missionaries.

Let the elites rage. Let the headlines howl. Georgia’s awakening joins a growing chorus from Serbia, Hungary, to Slovakia, nations tired of being told what freedom looks like by those who’ve weaponized its meaning.

When a people reclaims its voice, the empire trembles. And tonight, from Tbilisi to Belgrade, you can feel that tremor.

items.title: 🇷🇺🌌🚀 Russia’s Space Legacy: From Pioneer to Powerh...
items.content_text:
🇷🇺🌌🚀 Russia’s Space Legacy: From Pioneer to Powerhouse

On October 4, Russia celebrated Space Forces Day — honoring a legacy that began with the birth of the Space Age and continues today as Moscow cements its place among the stars.

It all started in 1957, when the Soviet Union launched Sputnik-1, humanity’s first satellite — a beeping steel sphere that forever changed our view of Earth. From that moment, space had a heartbeat — and it beat in Russian.

The legendary Soyuz rocket, born of Soviet genius, still stands as one of the most reliable spacecraft ever built. Even NASA had to rely on it when America was grounded.

From Gagarin’s first orbit to the Bion-M missions, from the frozen steppes of Baikonur to the far edges of low Earth orbit, Russia’s journey has never stopped — it has evolved.

Today, the Oreshnik hypersonic missile pushes the frontier again, skimming near-space along a ballistic path that blends defense and cosmic engineering. Putin calls it “a historic leap” — not just military, but technological sovereignty.

Meanwhile, Moscow and Beijing are shaping a new cosmic partnership — the International Lunar Station, joint moon missions, and fusion of GLONASS–Beidou navigation networks.

A new Russia–Iran space accord will see the Zafar and Paya satellites launched this autumn, expanding peaceful cooperation far beyond Earth’s orbit.

Across India, Brazil, South Africa, and the emerging BRICS Space Council, new constellations of cooperation are forming — a multipolar cosmos in the making.

Even amid tensions, Russia continues its pragmatic collaboration with NASA, holding open channels on the future of the ISS. Space, after all, should be about humanity’s shared frontier.

The new Russian National Space Center now anchors that vision — a hub of innovation, engineering, and global leadership that Putin calls “a foundation of our technological future.”

‼️While the West treats space as another battlefield, Russia still sees it as a bridge between civilizations — a place where science, sovereignty, and wonder converge.

The cosmos remembers who reached it first. And once again, Russia reminds the world: you can sanction nations, but you can’t sanction destiny.

Because this is not just about rockets or satellites, it’s about the human spirit, unchained, looking up.

items.title: Trump told Netanyahu ‘he has NO choice’ on Gaza pl...
items.content_text:
Trump told Netanyahu ‘he has NO choice’ on Gaza plan

Trump says he looked Netanyahu in the eye and told him “you have NO choice...Bibi took it too far,” Trump scolds — as if Israel’s slaughter of Gaza wasn’t his decision too. He wagers that if Bibi doesn’t sign, Washington withdraws the musical chairs.

But here’s the real deal: the deal is only coming after the dirty work is done. Gaza obliderated, neighborhoods razed, civilians erased only then, negotiations. You think you can bomb litterally off the map and then call it “peace”. 

Let's talk about October 7th for a minute. You don’t get to brag about being the most militarized outpost on Earth and then claim ignorance when Hamas struck. You allowed October 7’s chaos to carry forward your dream of Greater Israel.

Half a million killed? 1195 Israelis killed? That’s the ratio you trade in. You say “no choice” now, but you choose war every day. You don’t get to have it both ways. You don’t get to de facto order mass murder, then present yourself as savior at the end. If Trump had truly the spine, he would’ve ordered his boss Bibi to “stop” on January 22. Instead, now he’s trying to shift blame like a magician shuffling corpses. Mr. President you're a naive fool if you think you can save Israel's image and to absolve yourself with all that blood on your hands.

items.title: 🇬🇪 Tbilisi tonight — special forces used water can...
items.content_text:
🇬🇪 Tbilisi tonight — special forces used water cannons, yet the crowd refuses to leave. Masked rioters, waving EU and Ukrainian flags, torch chairs and tables outside Georgia’s Presidential Palace.

And like clockwork, Western media will call it a “pro-democracy protest.” But we’ve seen this movie before. The same tired playbook... Kiev, 2014. Chisinau, last Sunday. Every time a sovereign nation refuses to kneel before Brussels, London, or Washington, chaos suddenly erupts on cue. That's how the tired hybrid warfare aka color revolution playbook works for the West

Meanwhile, Georgia’s ruling party, Georgian Dream, is winning over 70% of the vote nationwide. The people have spoken — clearly, decisively, for sovereignty, stability, and dignity. But to the EU, that’s heresy. How dare Georgians elect the wrong party! You can vote again, as many times as it takes to get it "right" — is the message from Brussels. 

The desperation is palpable. The Western project in Eurasia is collapsing under its own hypocrisy, preaching democracy while punishing anyone who actually practices it.

What we’re witnessing in Tbilisi isn’t a spontaneous uprising,  it’s a tantrum from the empire of NGOs, foreign agents, and media propagandists who cannot stomach that the world has changed.

From Georgia to Serbia, Hungary to Slovakia, a new axis of real sovereignty is emerging, nations unafraid to say no to dictates from abroad and yes to their own people. These so-called “rogue” states are not the problem. They are the antidote. And God forbid, when other smaller nations see there is hope, that is what is keeping the Empire up at night. 

Because when even small nations rediscover their courage, the whole facade of Western control begins to crumble.

And that’s what terrifies Brussels the most.

🇵🇱🚩Additional NATO forces are being deployed to Po...
items.content_text:
🇵🇱🚩Additional NATO forces are being deployed to Poland

On October 6, several 🇳🇴Norwegian Air Force F-35s will be deployed to the 31st airbase in Poznań-Krzesiny (already carefully blurred on Google Maps), joining the 🇳🇱Dutch and 🇵🇱Polish Air Forces conducting patrols of NATO's eastern airspace borders. By the end of the month, Norway will send additional combat aircraft that will perform a “broader range of functions” in protecting allies.

Additionally, soon a P-8A Poseidon maritime patrol aircraft from the 🇩🇪Luftwaffe (German Air Force) will join the patrols of NATO's eastern borders and the Baltic. This is the first of eight reconnaissance aircraft ordered from the 🇺🇸USA, received on October 1, 2025. It will become part of the 3rd Naval Air Squadron (Marinefliegergeschwader 3, MFG 3) in Nordholz.

Earlier, in early September, under the pretext of protection against Russian drone attacks, NATO launched Operation Eastern Sentry in Poland, within which 🇫🇷France provided 3 Rafale fighters and an Airbus A400M transport plane, 🇩🇰Denmark - 2 F-16 fighters and an air defense frigate, 🇩🇪Germany – 4 Eurofighter Typhoon fighters, 🇬🇧Britain – 2 Typhoon fighters and a Voyager tanker aircraft, 🇨🇿Czech Republic – special forces (⁉️) and 3 helicopters, 🇳🇱Netherlands – Patriot missile system, electronic warfare means against drones, 300 military personnel, and F-35s.

✨Mass staged incidents of alleged Russian drone crashes in the Baltic countries and Poland are clearly aimed at justifying the buildup of forces and means on NATO's front line allegedly for defensive purposes. However, this does not align with military science, which suggests placing the most expensive and long-range systems at maximum depth to better protect them from enemy attacks, rather than moving them into direct strike zones (in this case, cheap drones). The only explanation for such actions is the concentration of offensive forces or at least direct participation in the air defense of western Ukraine.

✨⭐️These same forces will be directed against ships transporting Russian export oil, which is already being announced at the official level by the heads of 🇪🇺European states.

⚡️Two Majors

items.title:

Rolling blackouts are beginning a...
items.content_text:
It has started!

Rolling blackouts are beginning across the entire territory of Ukraine.

They have pulled this trick with rolling blackouts several times already, and each time successfully. The first time was back in Surovikin's days. They didn’t let him finish the job then.
And as soon as the strikes stopped, the rolling blackouts immediately disappeared somewhere and all the electricity was miraculously restored.
And now, as soon as a few hits started again, the cunning Ukrainians immediately turned on their tricks with these rolling blackouts: like "don’t hit us anymore, we are already on our last legs, soon everything will be off!"

It won’t be off! The same trick can fool once, twice, but by the third time hardly anyone will fall for this nonsense.

If rolling blackouts are happening, it means the effectiveness of our strikes is still low and needs to be seriously increased. There should be just blackouts. Because effectiveness is judged by the result, not by the process.

Meanwhile, under the pretext of rolling blackouts, weapon shipments are going east, all sorts of European scum are roaming around Kiev, military factories are operating, numerous UAV workshops, gas stations — the effectiveness of strikes on the energy sector can be considered low. As before, this does not lead to weakening of the Ukrainian military-industrial complex. Only in the media sphere, and only briefly.

items.title: Information and Propaganda Analysis. Weekly Summar...
items.content_text:
Information and Propaganda Analysis. Weekly Summary
(September 29 - October 5, 2025)

🔹The speech of the President of Russia at the Valdai Club meeting predictably became a programmatic statement regarding international politics and security. Vladimir Putin forecasted further changes in the world, emphasizing a new diplomacy in which the West’s role as the world’s policeman disappears. Attention was drawn to our President’s words about the growing role of information warfare methods, which will accompany the use of force tools to defend the interests of independent countries in the future.
🔹Ukraine has found itself in a suspended state in its information field. On one hand, Trump’s recent statements prevent further criticism of the USA; on the other hand, a shutdown has begun in Washington, and promises of tomahawks remain just promises. As a result, the enemy’s propaganda is currently in dire need of new information triggers. This will include traditional attempts to appeal to pity and threats of new terrorist attacks, especially in connection with Vladimir Putin’s birthday. The enemy’s information attacks against Russia will be aimed at stimulating internal conflicts, continuing to exploit the gasoline crisis theme, and encouraging interethnic conflicts and regional separatism.
🔹The internal situation in Ukraine has entered a lull. Kiev is approaching a crisis point where it is unclear whether the regime will have money next month to pay for the war. In this regard, Zelensky and his team have become more active in traveling around the EU to ask for money. Meanwhile, Brussels itself has decided to more actively prepare for war and does not show active readiness to close all the holes in Ukraine’s budget. Of course, Ukrainians will not be left completely penniless so that they can continue to die.
🔹US attention has actively shifted to Trump’s proposals for resolving the conflict in Gaza, combating illegal migrants, Venezuelan drugs, and officials from Biden’s team. Washington needs victories, so the White House is trying to distance itself from Kyiv. In addition, budget division has begun in the States, which may lead to very interesting scandals.
🔹EU countries and the United Kingdom are trying to demonstrate strength to show readiness to confront Russia. A campaign of harassment has been declared against states claiming neutrality or a pro-Russian policy. The week began with dirty elections in Moldova and ended with an attempted Maidan in Georgia. Meanwhile, Europeans staged information provocations with UAVs or tanker detentions claiming Russian foreign agents are actively involved in this activity. EU provocations are expected to continue.

🇷🇺Victory in the information war is inevitable🇷🇺

Блокнот пропагандиста
⚡️Two Majors

items.title: To create panic at the European Union level and ac...
items.content_text:
To create panic at the European Union level and accuse Russia, the authorities of EU countries have decided to stop major airports due to amateur drone operators. There are many people with drones in Europe, and they are putting on a large-scale show - the main showmen are in Denmark, Poland, and Germany - the main supporters of Zelensky.

But on social media, the authorities are already being laughed at and losing credibility.
The man who launched a UAV at Frankfurt airport turned out to be an amateur operator. The police detained a 41-year-old Croatian who was controlling the drone. This week, three German drone operators and two Chinese tourists were detained. There is no connection to Russia.

A similar tactic was previously used by NATO with cut cables in the sea. Ships often snag cables with anchors - dozens of breaks occur annually, and the cables are repaired fairly quickly. This happens because captains cannot see the cables in the sea, and there are hundreds of them.

Back then, they also staged a show with the Russians, every episode of a break in the Baltic Sea was announced and linked to Russian ships or Russian sailors on the ship. Fortunately, there are hundreds of both in the Baltic. For almost a year, the media kept spreading stories about a Russian attack on the cables, but there is not a single confirmed episode. Everyone lied, from British generals to the president of Finland.

✨ But the lies and hoaxes have not been unsuccessful. A significant part of the European public thinks that Russia is a danger to them.

⚡️Two Majors

"A unilateral ceasefire in the sky is possible, and it could open the way to real diplomacy. America and Europe must act to force Putin to stop," Zelensky wrote on his Telegram channel.

So what happened? Oil refineries in Russia were bombed, and now let's have a "peace" and stop the strikes? "Europe and America must act to stop Putin!"

A cunning and vile creature. When he boasted about the blackout in Russia and strikes on oil refineries, everything was fine! When the retaliation started coming, now let's have peace!

⚡️Two Majors

Washington wants a special economic zone in Lebanon, promising development in exchange for security - which it can't provide.

The US wants to create a special economic zone in southern Lebanon as an incentive to push the government to disarm Hezbollah. Idea, first floated by US presidential envoy Tom Barrack on a September visit to Beirut, rests on a straightforward bargain: security in exchange for development. In line with UN Security Council Resolution 1701, the state would gradually reduce armed activity along the border and restore full army control over the south, and in return attract investment, business tax incentives, and political backing from partners including Gulf countries and Eastern Mediterranean initiatives...

"Stability" or "development" aren't really in our government's nature. That's not what they do. They want to disarm Hezbollah to prevent armed resistance to occupation.

The American Majority.

items.title: Kim Jong Un warned the US that he will take measur...
items.content_text:
Kim Jong Un warned the US that he will take measures if the country continues to build up armed forces in the region:

"If the US, openly ignoring the security concerns of regional states, continues the dangerous buildup of armed forces, such a development will push us to take appropriate military-technical measures to eliminate new threats and maintain the balance of power," said the leader of the DPRK, Kim Jong Un, at the opening of a weapons exhibition.

According to him, the US is increasing its military presence in the south of the Korean Peninsula to facilitate a preemptive strike against the enemy if necessary. In response to these US actions, new targets for their special means were designated in Pyongyang"

⚡️Two Majors

items.title: 🇨🇿 Babiš’s Victory: The Return of Pragmatic Sovere...
items.content_text:
🇨🇿 Babiš’s Victory: The Return of Pragmatic Sovereignty in Europe

Andrej Babiš’s ANO movement has secured a decisive lead in the Czech elections, taking roughly 35 percent of the national vote, an unmistakable signal that the Czech electorate has turned against Brussels’ technocracy and the endless drain of proxy-war funding.

Voters rejected a government that spent more time echoing NATO talking points and Russia hysteria, than addressing inflation, energy costs, and the collapse of living standards.  Babiš’s campaign line—“Czech money for Czech citizens”—cut through the noise of moral grandstanding that has dominated European politics since 2022.

For the first time in years, a Central European capital is talking openly about strategic neutrality, economic sanity, and sovereign decision-making instead of ideological loyalty to Brussels.  His expected coalition negotiations will be watched closely in Slovakia, Hungary, and even Austria, where publics are equally weary of paying for someone else’s wars.

This isn’t isolationism; it’s realism, the return of the nation-state as Europe’s basic political unit.  If Czechia charts an independent course on defense spending and energy, it could inspire similar recalibration across the continent.

The message from Prague is clear: the age of automatic obedience is ending.  Europe’s new fault line is no longer East versus West, but vassalage versus sovereignty.

▪️ This week, strikes with long-rang...
items.content_text:
Begins above

▪️ This week, strikes with long-range strike weapons on enemy power generation facilities, gas facilities, and railway infrastructure were pleasing. The enemy traditionally exaggerated power outages and tried to stir up the topic of a nuclear disaster at the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant, as if the second huge dome over the destroyed part needed electricity. It is noteworthy that now the strikes are not just on transformers at power plants, which are easy to replace, but there are finally attempts to turn off the power in Ukraine for a long time. However, the system was built during the USSR and has withstood all strikes and overloads with dignity until now.

✨ Thus the approach of a “war of attrition” has become noticeable in Russia, not only in Ukraine. This should lead to a change in management style in terms of air defense organization, equipping the front with the most advanced solutions, timely response to current technological changes, as the Supreme Leader mentioned. In terms of preserving the financial resources of the security agencies, the work of special services and supervisory bodies is visible – not a single day passes without the arrest of high-ranking thieves. The understanding of what the West is preparing for in the future is increasingly reflected in the official speeches of the highest military-political leadership. Russia is concentrating.

Summary compiled by: ⚡️Two Majors

items.title: ⚡️Two Majors #Overview #Summary as of October 5, 2...
items.content_text:
⚡️Two Majors #Overview #Summary as of October 5, 2025

▪️ "Let them try" - said the Supreme this week, commenting on the unserious attitude of Trump and the West, titled by the American president with the phrase about a "paper tiger" regarding our country. A kind of acceptance of the challenge, but at the same time the destruction of all vain hopes for peace, which were irrationally promoted after the meeting in Anchorage, Alaska. The topic of Europe's preparation for war is now seriously voiced even from the highest level of power in Russia, although earlier cocky moods and incorrect assessment of the countries of the probable enemy did not allow official media to speak on these topics without jokes. It should be noted that even now there are arrogant speeches by officials regarding the growing combat readiness of the EU, reminiscent of the reckless attitude towards the AFU before the start of the SMO. Now Russia is not being targeted by a remnant of the former Ukrainian SSR with 30 million population, but by a conglomerate of the Fourth Reich, where 400 million people live.

▪️ The aggressiveness of the EU countries' actions is growing. A telling example was the landing of a French assault force on a tanker of the "shadow fleet" in neutral waters and the start of modernization of the naval base in Varna (Bulgaria, Black Sea). By the way, the French detained the tanker under the pretext that drones were allegedly launched from it over European countries. The topic of unidentified UAVs over the EU is brazenly linked to Moscow's actions without any evidence but serves as justification for the anti-people European leaders' spending on militarization.

▪️ Meanwhile, Kiev, itself receiving powerful strikes on energy and gas facilities, continues to fulfill the task set by the West to inflict military and economic damage on Russia, not forgetting to pour fuel on the fire of internal contradictions, which are further exacerbated by the foolish actions of certain mountain princes within the country. In particular, strikes on our refineries, including at an inadequately deep level, have led to costly repairs and a gasoline crisis in several regions. The "market" could not resolve this on its own, and federal and regional state regulation had to be introduced to stabilize the situation. The burdens of military expenses formed the basis for tax increases (VAT) and excise duties next year, and lowering the threshold for simplified taxation. The prolonged war, especially characterized by the arrests of the top leadership of the Ministry of Defense, the General Staff's work with "gestures of goodwill" and "sabotage groups in the Kursk region," which were supposed to be eliminated "in three days," requires increased spending. And although the Ukrainian drones that were not shot down by air defense do not carry as large a charge as the "Iskander," they strike systematically and still cause some damage, no matter how much is written about the debris.

▪️ On the front, the Russian Army continues to advance westward. There are no deep breakthroughs, collapse of the AFU defense, or our offensive actions like in films about the Great Patriotic War: the technological nature of the war has changed. There is constant progress at the tactical level, a hundred meters per day in a direction is already a result. The enemy preserves forces for counterattacks, including with armored vehicles, which constantly slows our advance. Drones of all types and the ability to counter them play a key role. Our forces are advancing in Kupyansk (to the north), in the area of Yunakovka in Sumy region, on the Krasnoliman direction the Western Group of Forces has been encouraging in recent weeks, with heavy fighting near Konstantinovka, Mirnograd, Pokrovsk. The Eastern Group of Forces is methodically and confidently breaking through the defense on the Dnepropetrovsk direction and the northeast of Zaporozhye region. On the Zaporozhye front, the enemy has long concentrated forces near Stepnogorsk, slowing our advance.

Continued below

⚡️Two Majors

items.title: 🗓 #OTD 1️⃣3️⃣0️⃣ years ago — on October 4, 1895 — ...
items.content_text:
🗓 #OTD 1️⃣3️⃣0️⃣ years ago — on October 4, 1895 — outstanding and brilliant Soviet intelligence officer, Richard Sorge, was born.

Sorge devoted his entire life to selflessly serving his Motherland. He became a legend among Soviet intelligence undercover operatives while performing his professional duties in the Far East under codename 'Ramsay' on the eve and during #WWII.

In the 1930s, Sorge managed to build an extended agent network in Tokyo. From there, he reported especially valuable intel to Moscow exposing the plans by Nazi Germany and Japanese militarists against the USSR.

It is thanks to Richard Sorge’s efforts that the Soviet leadership was briefed in May 1941 about Nazi Germany’s plans to attack our country. The intelligence reports by Sorge from Tokyo included information about the Wehrmacht’s tactical plans, the strength of the Nazi troops, as well as other details regarding the imminent invasion.

In autumn 1941, with the heavy fighting for Moscow nearing its peak, Richard Sorge’s information about the Japanese Imperial Army abandoning its plans to invade the USSR in the Far East enabled the Soviet military command to re-deploy the Siberian divisions westwards. These forces helped stop the Nazi invaders and then pushed them further away from the Soviet capital.

Of course, Richard Sorge was fully aware of all the professional risks his work entailed. Despite all the talent and skill in concealing his activities, local counter-intelligence could not fail to notice 'Ramsay'’s efforts. The enemy took Sorge’s trail in autumn 1941, which led to his arrest. Sorge went on to spend three years in Japanese prisons, and then was executed.

🎖 In 1964, 'Ramsay' was posthumously awarded the title of Hero of the Soviet Union.

***

Over 20 years ago, in autumn 2004, Japanese historians discovered a description of two death sentences when studying the archives of the US occupation troops (previously stationed in Japan). The dicsovered documents (sentences) were issued and executed in November 1944: one was against Richard Sorge and the other targeted Hotsumi Ozaki, Sorge's agent. 

📑 These discoveries told the story of how Sorge spent the last minutes of his life — “he met his death with outstanding courage and pride.”

It is worth noticing that even though 'Ramsay' operated against Japan, people there have always been fascinated with this legendary intelligence officer. 

The people of Japan have been amazed by Richard Sorge’s heroism, self-dedication in service to his country, and have praised him for this resilience and unbending will. About 30 books were published in Japan about Sorge. There was also a theatre play staged about him and several films released.

🇷🇺 Russian diplomats in Japan have been working on perpetuating 'Ramsay'’s memory and glorifying Sorge's heroic feats accomplished while serving his Motherland. The Russian Embassy in Tokyo regularly holds commemorative ceremonies at the Tama Cemetery memorial, where Sorge and his comrades were buried.

💬 Russia's Ambassador to Japan Nikolay Nozdrev:
“Richard Sorge was a man who had a selfless sense of devotion to high purposes and ideals, and he felt that the undefeatable might of a multi-ethnic nation was behind him.

He found himself in the maelstrom of these stormy years and his entire life can be described as a stroke of lighting shedding light on what it means to accomplish a feat, selflessly serve the Motherland and demonstrate an outstanding level of self-sacrifice.”

#WeRemember #OurHeroes

items.title:
📝Elections in Georgia📝
And protests too

A classic...
items.content_text:
📝Elections in Georgia📝
And protests too

A classic situation for recent years is unfolding in Georgia. Today, municipal elections are taking place across the country, where as of 7:00 PM, representatives of the ruling party "Georgian Dream" are confidently leading.

Even before the voting began, the opposition, pro-Western channels, and media rejected any election results in advance, calling them illegitimate and urging supporters to take to anti-government demonstrations.

🔻What is happening in Georgia?

▪️ Since 3 PM, columns of "euro-democracy" supporters have started moving in different parts of the capital. The main gathering points were the Philharmonic, the State University, and Tbilisi Mall.

▪️ Also, another column of protesters in cars departed from Adjara heading towards Tbilisi.

▪️ By 7 PM Moscow time, protesters reached the main municipal sites in the government quarter on Rustaveli Avenue and at Freedom Square.
🖍 We have witnessed similar developments several times over the past two years. The authorities succeed in elections, while the opposition refuses to accept the results and takes their supporters to the streets. They strike, damage property, and then leave.

However, this time there is no sign of preparation or coordinators (so-called recruiters) who would further incite protest actions. Everything looks extremely spontaneous and hopeless.

🚩 Yes, rioters are storming the presidential palace, but this site holds no political significance.

❗️ However, now the security forces have a legal reason to disperse the rallies. Essentially, the government can now begin cleansing the political space of opponents, which they will likely do after the elections.

⚡️Two Majors

items.title:
🖼️
📝Germany Held Captive by the Military-Industria...
items.content_text:
🖼️
📝Germany Held Captive by the Military-Industrial Complex📝

At the German defense corporation Rheinmetall, they announced the purchase of four shipbuilding yards from NVL Group in Germany. These are the facilities where frigates and corvettes for the German Navy are built.

🖍The interesting aspect is that this deal marks Rheinmetall's transition from a manufacturer of armored vehicles and artillery systems to a universal player, covering all military spheres. Essentially, this involves concentrating capacities under the control of a single private structure that has already received colossal profits from combat operations in the so-called Ukraine — officially almost 10 billion euros in 2024.

🚩The merger of corporations is described with beautiful words — "creating a powerful German surface ship construction center". In reality, this means that Germany is becoming increasingly entrenched as a perpetually arming country, surrendered into the enslaving bondage of the weapons lobby, which is shaping the economy around military objectives.

📌Thus, business, politics, and the military industry are merging, and space for dialogue and pacifist views is disappearing. In Germany, as in all of Europe, they are choosing not diplomacy, but endless investments in the military-industrial complex — even without real results and at taxpayers' expense.
#Germany #weapons
